# scAlign setup
## Create paired dataset SCE objects to pass into scAlignCreateObject
Hs_liver.scalign <- SingleCellExperiment(
    assays = list(counts     = Hs_liver.one2one@assays$RNA@counts[genes.use,],
                  logcounts  = Hs_liver.one2one@assays$RNA@data[genes.use,],
                  scale.data = Hs_liver.one2one@assays$RNA@scale.data[genes.use,])
)

Mm_liver.scalign <- SingleCellExperiment(
  assays = list(counts     = Mm_liver.one2one@assays$RNA@counts[genes.use,],
                logcounts  = Mm_liver.one2one@assays$RNA@data[genes.use,],
                scale.data = Mm_liver.one2one@assays$RNA@scale.data[genes.use,])
)

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:
